title: Dinner Tonight: Pan-Seared Trout with Garlic and Basil
summary: Dinner Tonight: Pan-Seared Trout with Garlic and Basil might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 4 and costs $5.47 per serving. Watching your figure? This caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe has 391 calories, 35g of protein, and 21g of fat per serving. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. Head to the store and pick up lemon, basil leaves, garlic cloves, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 90%. This score is spectacular. Similar recipes include Dinner Tonight: Garlic Shrimp with Basil, Tomatoes, and Pepper Flakes, Dinner Tonight: Smoked Trout Brandade, and Dinner Tonight: Cornmeal-Crusted Pan-Fried Trout.
instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Rinse the fillets and pat dry.  Season with salt and pepper, then heat a large (12-inch) skillet over medium-high heat with the olive oil.  Sear the fillets for a minute on each side.                                                                                                                            2                                                                            Scatter the garlic and basil leaves around the fish, turn the heat to low, cover, and continue cooking about five minutes or until the fish is close to cooked through.  Turn the fillets midway through cooking.                                                                                                                            3                                                                            Remove the fish and keep warm. Add the wine to the skillet, turn the heat to high, and scrape up any brown bits. Reduce until beginning to get syrupy.  Add the spinach and snow peas and toss with the sauce, until the spinach is well-wilted.                                                                                                                            4                                                                            Serve the fish on the bed of spinach topped with a squeeze of fresh lemon.

steps.step: Rinse the fillets and pat dry.  Season with salt and pepper, then heat a large (12-inch) skillet over medium-high heat with the olive oil.  Sear the fillets for a minute on each side.

Scatter the garlic and basil leaves around the fish, turn the heat to low, cover, and continue cooking about five minutes or until the fish is close to cooked through.  Turn the fillets midway through cooking.
Remove the fish and keep warm.
Add the wine to the skillet, turn the heat to high, and scrape up any brown bits. Reduce until beginning to get syrupy.
Add the spinach and snow peas and toss with the sauce, until the spinach is well-wilted.
Serve the fish on the bed of spinach topped with a squeeze of fresh lemon.
